place.name: PENTERRY
place.gazetteerText: PENTERRY, a parish in Chepstow district, Monmouth; near the river Wye, 3½ miles N by W of Chepstow r. station. Post-town, Chepstow. Acres, 479. Real property, £533. Pop., 28. Houses, 9. The property is divided among a few. The living is a p. curacy in the diocese of Llandaff. Value, £65. Patrons, the Chapter of Llandaff. The church is not good. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
